results.title: Love me or leave me
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Show-casing her dramatic capabilities, Doris Day gives a surprising performance as the 1930’s torch singer Ruth Etting. Etting’s big break came when she was discovered by Chicago gangster Martin, “The Gimp” Snyder. Using the ruthless methods that he is accustomed to, the Gimp fulfills Ruth’s ambitions by providing her with material riches and renown on stage and screen. He also provides her with his hand in marriage. She pays a high cost personally however, living in an atmosphere of violence and fear that worsens when Martin discovers that Ruth has fallen in love with musician Johnny Alderman (Cameron Mitchell). Nominated for 6 Academy Awards, “Love me or leave me” is a departure from traditional musicals as it focuses on the trials and tribulations of love, fear and tragedy in relationships, played out against a backdrop of songs such as “Mean to me”, “Ten cents a dance” and “I’ll never stop loving you”. Cast also includes Robert Keith and Tom Tully.

results.title: White hunter: black heart
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: One of Clint Eastwood’s most engaging films, “White hunter, black heart” is based on Peter Vietel’s novel about the location shoot of John Huston’s immortal “The African Queen”. The focus, however, is never on Bogie and Hepburn, but rather on the obsessive director who is determined to turn his new film project into a grand personal quest, hunting a wild elephant. Cast includes Clint Eastwood, Jeff Fahey, George Dzundza, Alun Armstrong and Marisa Berenson.

results.title: The Client
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Arnon Milchan, Steven Reuther, Monarchy Enterprises B. V. and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Mark Sway, an 11 year old trailer park kid (Brad Renfro) witnesses the suicide of a Mafia lawyer, who confesses that the Mob was behind the murder of a U.S. senator. Mark’s brother is traumatized into a coma by the incident and soon Mark finds himself torn between what he knows and what he can never tell. Gangster Barry Muldano (Anthony LaPaglia) is on Mark’s trail, and in desperation Mark arrives at the office of recovering alcoholic lawyer Reggie Love (Susan Sarandon). With the Mob after them, and a ruthless federal attorney (Tommy Lee Jones) trying to force Mark to reveal what he knows, Love battles to guarantee the safety of her client and his family. Based on the novel by John Grisham. Music by Howard Shore.

results.title: Reunion in France
results.creator_credit: Jules Dassin, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Frenchwoman Michele de la Becque (Joan Crawford) is a pampered Parisian whose high society lifestyle abruptly changes with the Nazi invasion of Paris. A downed RAF pilot on the run - Pat Talbot (John Wayne), enters her world seeking asylum, which Michele provides by hiding him in her tiny apartment. His escape however is reliant on the co-operation of Michele’s rich industrialist finace Robert Corlot (Phillip Dorn) - who may also be a Nazi collaborator, a situation which is fraught with danger when love and allegiance are on the line. Cast also includes Reginald Owen, Albert Bassermann and John Carradine.

results.title: Merrill's marauders
results.creator_credit: Samuel Fuller, Milton Sperling, United States Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The viewer is plunged directly into war. The documentary element - the reconstruction of the campaign of General Merrill’s American infantry regiment deep behind Japanese lines in Burma - seems to exist on a level independent of the more stylised attempt to abstract the rhythms of combat and survival. Because he experienced combat at first hand as an infantry man in World War II, Fuller has a certain commitment to represent that reality thus bringing the contradictions between re-creation and generic convention closer to the surface than is usual for the combat genre.

results.title: Take me out to the ball game
results.creator_credit: Busby Berkeley, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: To keep themselves occupied during the off season, Wolves baseball players O’Brien and Ryan (Gene Kelly and Frank Sinatra) moonlight as a song and dance team, much to the chagrin of more dedicated players on the team such as Goldberg (Jules Munshin). When training begins for the new season, they are surprised to learn that the new coach - K C Higgins, is keen to take a more active role in coaching. Fearing the worst, O’Brien and Ryan are pleasantly surprised to learn that the new coach is an attractive woman (Esther Williams) who knows her way around the baseball field. Friendly rivalry rears its head as the two friends both fall for the new coach, but eventually she must decide on one, and does so by choosing O’Brien. All is not lost for Ryan either, who finds himself in the arms of Shirley. O’Brien and Ryans love for vaudeville could be the undoing of the teams success however, as O’Brien is approached with a bribe by Gambler Joe Lorgan (Edward Arnold) to ditch baseball for the entertainment industry. Musical numbers staged by Stanley Donen and Gene Kelly. Cast also includes Betty Garrett, Edward Arnold and Jules Munshin.

results.title: Damn Yankees = What Lola wants
results.creator_credit: George Abbott, Stanley Donen and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Joe Boyd (Robert Schafer), an aging business man and avid baseball follower makes a deal with the devilish Applegate (Ray Walston) to relive his youth and regain a position in the Washington Senators. In the process Boyd becomes the young, handsome “Shoeless” Joe Hardy (played by Tab Hunter), a star baseball player that earns his success at the cost of Boyd’s soul. Boyd has a plan however - or so he thinks, a plan which seems destined to fail when Applegate sends in a beautiful decoy (Gwen Verdon) to seduce the baseball player. It all boils down to a tense game against the New York Yankees in which winning the pennant will also win back Joe’s soul. Based on the Broadway play of the same name and written specially for the screen by Richard Adler, who co-authorised all the original songs with Jerry Ross.

results.title: Thousands cheer
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A professional singer who is also a Colonel’s daughter (Kathryn Grayson), decides to follow in her father’s footsteps and join him by entertaining the troops he has been assigned to train. On the platform prior to departure, she meets Private Eddy Marsh (Gene Kelly) who impulsively kisses her in the belief that she is one of the women farewelling the troops. After the train has left the two meet again, and Kathryn jokingly says that she followed the private on board to propose to him. When Eddy goes to her cabin to discuss the issue, he finds Kathryn there with her father, and demands to be transferred to another division, the Army Air Corps. On the advice from friends that the quickest way to get a transfer is to ingratiate himself with the Colonel’s daughter, Eddy soon develops a relationship with her. Eddy’s attentions suit Kathryn too, as she uses the ruse of saying that she’s fallen in love to try and bring her mother to see her, and be united with her ex-husband - Kathryn’s father. Eddy takes Kathryn to see the Flying Corbinos, a trapeze act in which Eddie used to be the star, but had to abandon when forced into National Service. Eddy and Kathryn fall in love, and Kathryn gets her wish of her mother being united with her father, the only problem is she’s come to break up her daughter and the man she now loves. The film culminates in a dazzling array of stars from the MGM payroll including Judy Garland, Mickey Rooney, Red Skelton, Lucille Ball, Eleanor Powell, Ann Sothern, Lena Horn, June Allyson and Donna Reed, as well as Eddy rejoining the Corbino family for a performance for the troops. Cast also includes Mary Astor, John Boles, Ben Blue, Frances Rafferty and Mary Elliott.

results.title: None but the brave
results.creator_credit: Frank Sinatra, Artanis and Sinatra Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Debuting director Frank Sinatra stars in this suspenseful war drama, the first American/Japanese film made in the United States. The story moves tautly between two enemy camps (both stranded on a deserted Pacific Island during World War II, both facing the same struggle for survival), gunfire is their only contact. Then the Japanese leader (Tatsuya Mihashi) offers to swap water for the aid of the American Pharmacist Maloney (Sinatra), whom he’s mistaken for a doctor. When Maloney amputates the leg of a Japanese soldier and saves his life, peace breaks out between the two camps. But can it last? There are two sides to every war… this movie shows the heroism of both sides… and the respect that can develop among courageous men at war.
Cast includes: Frank Sinatra, Clint Walker, Tatsuya Mihashi, Tony Bill.

results.title: The White cliffs of Dover
results.creator_credit: Clarence Brown, Sidney A. Franklin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This filmed interpretation of Alice Duer Miller’s poem features an all star cast of Irene Dunn, Roddy McDowall, Van Johnson, Dame May Whitty and C. Aubrey Smith. A young woman who moves from America to England with her father, meets and falls in love with Sir John Ashwood (Alan Marshal), an English baronet. They marry, and Susan soon falls pregnant, but tragically loses her husband to World War I before her son, John junior is born. Despite the prospect of isolation, she decides to remain in England (young son played by Roddy McDowall, adult son by Peter Lawford). Susan’s painful relationship with war and tragedy is relived years later when her son expresses a wish to go to war like his father. Reluctantly she agrees, as well as becoming a volunteer with the Red Cross. Once again, a mother’s love is placed in the hands of fate as the waiting game begins.
